p: SARS-CoV-2 mainly infect alveolar epithelial type II (AE2) cells ( Zhao et al., 2020), the receptor for SARS-CoV-2, human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), is also expressed in 0.52% of oral cells, of which 95.86% is expressed in tongue epithelial cells ( Xu H. et al., 2020). This new evidence reveals that SARS-CoV-2 might interact with members of the oral microbiome in either the lungs or the oral cavity.
